title: 'Some of the milk ( was or were ) spilt', Which is the correct word in the blank space? - Quora

response.answer_text: ‘Were’ is used in the following ways - To set the subjunctive mood - The subjunctive mood is one of the three moods of the English language. It is used to talk about hypothetical situations, express wishes etc. Usually accompanied with ‘if’Example - “If I were a boy…..”In plural form - When the subject is in its plural form then the verb ‘were’ is used. Example - “The boys were playing in the garden.”Now, in the sentence given by you, there is milk is a noun which does not have a tense. If the unit of measurement, say ‘litres’ was also mentioned, then were would've been used.Example - “Five litres of milk were lost in transit.” Therefore, the correct sentence is - “Some of the milk was spilt.”
